additionalLabels.description: Additional set of labels to add to all the GCP resources

auth.description: Authentication settings for the cluster, optional, auto-populated

configSecret.description: Reference to the Secret containing the clusterâ€™s AuthenticationConfiguration, auto-populated

hash.description: Hash of the AuthenticationConfiguration data stored in the Secret, auto-populated

key.description: The data key in the Secret that contains the AuthenticationConfiguration, auto-populated

name.description: Name of the Secret that stores the AuthenticationConfiguration, auto-populated

clusterAnnotations.description: Annotations to apply to the cluster

clusterIdentity.description: The GCP Service Account credentials secret reference, auto-populated

name.description: The GCP Service Account credentials secret name, auto-populated

clusterLabels.description: Labels to apply to the cluster

apiServerPort.description: The port the API Server should bind to

pods.description: The network ranges from which Pod networks are allocated

services.description: The network ranges from which service VIPs are allocated

controlPlaneNumber.description: The number of the control plane pods

dataSource.description: Kine data source parameters, auto-populated, optional, auto-populated

caSecret.description: Reference to the Secret containing the certificate authority to connect to the data source, auto-populated

key.description: The data key in the Secret that contains the certificate authority to connect to the data source, auto-populated

name.description: Name of the Secret that stores the certificate authority to connect to the data source, auto-populated

kineDataSourceSecretName.description: Name of the Secret that stores the data source connection URL, auto-populated

extraArgs.description: Map of key-values (strings) for any extra arguments to pass down to Kubernetes api-server process

workerArgs.description: Args specifies extra arguments to be passed to k0s worker. See: https://docs.k0sproject.io/stable/worker-node-config/ See: https://docs.k0sproject.io/stable/cli/k0s_worker/

controllerPlaneFlags.description: ControlPlaneFlags allows to configure additional flags for k0s control plane and to override existing ones. The default flags are kept unless they are overriden explicitly. Flags with arguments must be specified as a single string, e.g. --some-flag=argument

apiPort.description: The kubernetes API port. If empty k0smotron will pick it automatically

konnectivityPort.description: The konnectivity port. If empty k0smotron will pick it automatically

type.description: An ingress methods for a service

name.description: The name of an existing GCP network or a new network that will be created by Cluster API Provider GCP

project.description: The name of the project to deploy the cluster to

region.description: The GCP Region the cluster lives in

additionalLabels.description: Additional set of labels to add to an instance, in addition to the ones added by default by the GCP provider. If both the GCPCluster and the GCPMachine specify the same tag name with different values, the GCPMachine's value takes precedence

additionalNetworkTags.description: A list of network tags that should be applied to the instance. These tags are set in addition to any network tags defined at the cluster level or in the actuator

image.description: The full reference to a valid image to be used for this machine. Takes precedence over imageFamily

imageFamily.description: The full reference to a valid image family to be used for this machine

instanceType.description: The type of instance to create. Example: n1.standard-2

ipForwarding.description: IPForwarding allows this instance to send and receive packets with non-matching destination or source IPs. This is required if you plan to use this instance to forward routes. Defaults to Enabled

providerID.description: The unique identifier as specified by the cloud provider

publicIP.description: PublicIP specifies whether the instance should get a public IP. Set this to true if you don't have a NAT instances or Cloud Nat setup

rootDeviceSize.description: The size of the root volume in GB

rootDeviceType.description: The type of the root volume

serviceAccount.description: The service account email and which scopes to assign to the machine

email.description: Email address of the service account

scopes.description: The list of scopes to be made available for this service account

subnet.description: A reference to the subnetwork to use for this instance. If not specified, the first subnetwork retrieved from the Cluster Region and Network is picked

workersNumber.description: The number of the worker nodes
